faq_pairs.question: Why is my withdrawable balance less than the trading balance?

Your withdrawable balance is the amount eligible for withdrawal on a given day. Any unsettled balance from your trades will be available for withdrawal on T+1 day (next working day).

• Profits from intraday transactions.
• Profits from F&O transactions.

faq_pairs.question: What are BSDA and non-BSDA accounts?
faq_pairs.answer:
BSDA (Basic Services Demat Account)
BSDA accounts provide limited services at a lower cost to retail account holders. Your account will be automatically a BSDA if it fulfills both the below conditions.
• You have only 1 Demat account across all stock brokers.
• The value of holdings in your account is less than 10 lakh.
Non-BSDA
Accounts that do not fulfill the above-mentioned criteria of BSDA are categorized as Non-BSDA.

faq_pairs.question: What are DP charges at Angel One?
faq_pairs.answer:
Depository Participant (DP) charges are combined charges imposed by CDSL and Angel One on every
Equity delivery
(Male – INR 3.5 (CDSL) + INR 16.5 (Angel One Charge))
(Female – INR 3.25 (CDSL) + INR 16.75 (Angle One Charge))
For example,
If you sell 100 shares of TCS on Monday at 10 am and again sell 50 shares later in the day, DP charges will be applicable twice. The total DP charges levied in this case will be Rs. 47.2.

faq_pairs.question: What are DP Charges?

faq_pairs.question: When are DP Charges levied?

faq_pairs.question: What are the charges for pledging of shares?
faq_pairs.answer:
Pledging of shares is charged a flat transaction fee, irrespective of the quantity pledged. A fixed transaction fee of ₹20 + GST is charged for each pledge and unpledge request, regardless of the number of shares. The split is as follows.
INR 5 (Depository) + INR 15 (Angel One Charge) + GST

faq_pairs.question: What are SEBI Charges?
faq_pairs.answer: SEBI charges are fees levied by SEBI for sale and purchase transactions in all types of securities.

faq_pairs.question: What are Stamp Duty charges?
faq_pairs.answer: Stamp duty is a direct tax levied on trading in stocks, currency derivatives and commodities, payable under Section 3 of the Indian Stamp Act, 1899.

faq_pairs.question: What are the charges for pledging and unpledging shares?
faq_pairs.answer:
A fixed transaction fee of ₹20 + GST is charged for each pledge and unpledge request, regardless of the number of shares. The split is as follows.
INR 5 (Depository) + INR 15 (Angel One Charge) + GST
For example,
Suppose you want to pledge 100 shares of ABC Ltd. and 50 shares of XYZ Ltd. You will be charged ₹40 + GST for 2 requests, irrespective of the number of shares in each request.
Similarly, if you want to place one unpledge request for 100 shares of ABC Ltd. and two unpledge requests for 50 shares and 20 shares of XYZ Ltd, respectively. In this case, you will be charged (₹20 x 3) = ₹60 + GST for 3 requests, irrespective of the number of shares in each request.

faq_pairs.question: Why is a particular scrip or scrips blocked from trading?
faq_pairs.answer: To safeguard the clients from undue loss arising due to monitoring price and volatility and detecting misleading activities such as insider trading, fictitious transactions, and more, particular scrip and scrips are blocked from trading.

faq_pairs.question: How much margin is charged for ASM/GSM scrip?
faq_pairs.answer:
The applicable margin while placing orders for ASM/GSM scrip will be 100% in all stages while the price band fluctuates.
For GSM: In Stage 1, the applicable margin shall be 100%, while, from Stage 2 onwards, an Additional Surveillance Deposit of 50% or 100% will be applicable based on GSM stage.
Note: Please know that clients will not be able to buy stocks that are in stage 2 of GSM or higher. These stocks will require Additional Surveillance Deposit (ASD) of 100% of the trade value or more and this margin will remain blocked by the exchange atleast for 2 months even after the stock is solid.

faq_pairs.question: What is a surveillance measure?
faq_pairs.answer: Market surveillance plays a key role in ensuring safety and integrity of the markets as it the process of prevention and investigation of abusive, manipulative or illegal trading practices in the securities markets. Surveillance Measure is an initative by the regulatory bodies and exchanges to protect traders and investors by monitoring price and volatility and detecting misleading activities like insider trading, fictitious transactions, and more.

faq_pairs.question: What is ASM?
faq_pairs.answer: SEBI (Securities and Exchange Board of India) along with the stock exchanges have initiated an Additional Surveillance Measure or ASM to safeguard investors’ interests by ensuring there are no market speculations or manipulations like unexpected price movements. The stocks are categorized under ASM for surveillance based on criteria specified by NSE

faq_pairs.question: What is GSM?
faq_pairs.answer: GSM or Graded Surveillance Measure is a system used by Indian Stock Exchanges like NSE and BSE to alert traders/investors and ask them to be extra cautious while dealing in certain securities which have been categorized under GSM. Scrips can be classified under GSM due to abnormal price hike that doesn’t match with the company’s financial health, are illiquid, have negligible market capital, and are underpreforming.

faq_pairs.question: What is the difference between ASM and GSM?
faq_pairs.answer: The main aim of the ASM framework is to control stock volatility, while the primary objective of GSM is to protect the investors from underperforming stocks by not allowing intraday trading and to advise them to be extra vigilant while dealing with securities that are witnessing unusual price fluctuations. Both these frameworks are introduced with different objectives, but their main goal is to protect traders and investors.

faq_pairs.question: When will a scrip be classified under GSM?
faq_pairs.answer: On the basis of below-mentioned pointers, Regulatory Body and the Exchanges make their decision of adding a scrip under GSM category:

faq_pairs.question: When will a scrip get out of ASM/GSM?
faq_pairs.answer: Every 2 months in the case of ASM and every quarter in the case of GSM, the stock can go in and out of the list based on the review carried out by the exchange.

faq_pairs.question: What are the surveillance measures under ASM?
faq_pairs.answer: Please find the detailed surveillance measures under ASM

faq_pairs.question: Why do I need to verify my mobile number?
faq_pairs.answer: Verifying your mobile number helps us create a secure account for you, ensuring a smooth app experience and the safety of your account.

faq_pairs.question: Can I continue if the mobile number linked to my bank is different from the one registered with the app?
faq_pairs.answer: No, your details, including your mobile number, must match those verified by our banking partner. A mismatch will result in your application being rejected by the bank.

faq_pairs.question: Why are permissions to send SMS and access phone state required?
faq_pairs.answer: These permissions are needed to verify your mobile number by sending an SMS. Rest assured, these permissions are used solely for verification purposes.

faq_pairs.question: Can I link any SIM for FD purchase if I have a dual SIM phone?
faq_pairs.answer: Yes, you can. However, we recommend using the SIM registered with your bank account for authentication.

faq_pairs.question: Can I retry the registration if it was not successful earlier?
faq_pairs.answer: Yes, you can retry. Ensure you use the SIM linked to your bank account for authentication.

faq_pairs.question: Can I invest in FD if I do not have a PAN?
faq_pairs.answer: No, currently, we only process fixed deposit requests for individuals with an active PAN.

faq_pairs.question: Why is my PAN not getting verified?
faq_pairs.answer: For booking fixed deposits, we need to verify your PAN with the regulated authorities. If there is a mismatch, the booking cannot be completed.

faq_pairs.question: What should I do if the name shown against my PAN is incorrect and I can't update it?
faq_pairs.answer: The name linked to your PAN should be accurate for successful identity verification and KYC purposes. Please update your name to match your PAN.

faq_pairs.question: Why is my Aadhar required?
faq_pairs.answer: Aadhar is mandatory for identification and KYC setup for your account, necessary for processing your FD request.

faq_pairs.question: Do I need a physical copy of my Aadhar?
faq_pairs.answer: No, a physical copy is not required. We use secure platforms like DigiLocker and CKYC for verifying your Aadhar and other documents.

faq_pairs.question: What is DigiLocker?
faq_pairs.answer: DigiLocker is a government initiative under the Digital India project for storing and verifying documents like PAN card, driving license, Aadhar card, school marksheets, and insurance papers.

faq_pairs.question: What should I do if there's a name mismatch and I can't complete the step?
faq_pairs.answer: For successful FD booking, the name on your Aadhar and PAN should match. Correct the details on either your PAN or Aadhar card and retry.

faq_pairs.question: How can I add a new address as my current address?
faq_pairs.answer: Use the “add” button on the address choice screen to add an address that is not listed.

faq_pairs.question: What should I do if I can't change my permanent address?
faq_pairs.answer: The address from your Aadhar is considered your permanent address. You may add or select your current address to proceed with the FD application.

faq_pairs.question: Can my permanent address be the same as my current address?
faq_pairs.answer: Yes, you can select your permanent address as your current address if they are the same.

faq_pairs.question: Why is video KYC required?
faq_pairs.answer: Video KYC is required to complete the KYC verification step as mandated by the RBI.

faq_pairs.question: What if I am not available during bank working hours?
faq_pairs.answer: If you have made the payment, we will notify you when the bank officers are available. If video KYC is not completed within 3 days, your money will be refunded to your bank account.

faq_pairs.question: When can I complete the Video KYC?
faq_pairs.answer: Video KYC is available from Monday to Saturday, 09:00 AM to 08:00 PM. We will notify you to complete the video KYC during these hours if pending.

faq_pairs.question: What if video KYC fails?
faq_pairs.answer: You can retry during banking hours within 2 days of FD booking if your video KYC fails.

faq_pairs.question: How will I know the status of my video KYC?
faq_pairs.answer: Your video KYC details are verified by bank officers, which may take up to 3 hours. Track the video KYC and FD confirmation status on the ‘My Investments’ tab.

faq_pairs.question: What should I do if I can't move to the next step and complete my KYC verification?
faq_pairs.answer: Retry using the correct details. If it still doesn’t work, try again later. If the issue persists, raise a ticket with our support team for assistance.

faq_pairs.question: Why are details related to occupation, income, and family required for FD booking?
faq_pairs.answer: These details are required by the bank to create your fixed deposit and ensure communication if needed.

faq_pairs.question: Why is my money deducted before video KYC?
faq_pairs.answer: Your money is deducted before video KYC as it is the last step to verify your identity and book your FD. Your money is safe with the bank, and interest starts accumulating from the time of payment. In case of issues with VKYC, your money will be refunded within 7 working days.

faq_pairs.question: What is required for completing a video KYC?
faq_pairs.answer: Keep your PAN Card and a blank paper with a pen ready for the VKYC process.

faq_pairs.question: How can I avoid giving the required consents?
faq_pairs.answer: To ensure a smooth and secure onboarding process, we require certain permissions to fetch and validate your personal details and for KYC purposes. These permissions are only used for account creation and validation.

faq_pairs.question: How safe is it to share my data using consents?
faq_pairs.answer: Your data is only used for account creation and KYC purposes, and it is not shared with any third parties. The safety of your information is our top priority.

faq_pairs.question: What is CKYC, and why do I need to consent to fetch CKYC data?
faq_pairs.answer: CKYC stands for Central KYC (Know Your Customer), an initiative by the Government of India to streamline the KYC process by making all relevant information available in one place. With your consent, we can access this information for a faster and safer onboarding experience.

faq_pairs.question: What details will be accessed from Digilocker for FD booking?
faq_pairs.answer: We will use the Digilocker facility to validate your identity and complete KYC by verifying documents like Aadhar and PAN.

faq_pairs.question: Can I open a Fixed Deposit if I am an Indian citizen but not a tax resident of India?
faq_pairs.answer: Currently, we can only process fixed deposit requests for users who are tax residents of India.

faq_pairs.question: What is a tax resident of India?
faq_pairs.answer:
A person is considered a resident of India if they have spent either:
• 182 days or more in India during the financial year, or
• 365 days or more in India during the four preceding years and 60 days or more during the current financial year.

faq_pairs.question: How can I book another FD if I already have one running?
faq_pairs.answer: Yes, you can invest in multiple Fixed Deposits (FDs) with different providers. You can also have multiple FDs with the same provider.

faq_pairs.question: What additional benefits can I avail as a senior citizen?
faq_pairs.answer: Most banks and NBFCs offer an additional interest rate of up to 0.5% over the regular fixed deposit interest rates for senior citizens, making it even more attractive for you.

faq_pairs.question: Can I book an FD as an NRI?
faq_pairs.answer: Currently, we are not able to process fixed deposit requests for NRIs.

faq_pairs.question: Can I book an FD as a minor?
faq_pairs.answer: Currently, we are not able to process fixed deposit requests for minors.

faq_pairs.question: What is a fixed deposit and why should I invest?
faq_pairs.answer: A fixed deposit (FD) is a popular and safe investment option in India. You invest a lump sum of money at an agreed interest rate and receive the amount along with interest upon maturity. The interest rates are fixed, higher than a regular savings account, and the investment is protected from market fluctuations.

faq_pairs.question: Is it safe to invest in an FD?
faq_pairs.answer: Yes, FDs are one of the safest investment options. Unlike market-led investments where returns fluctuate, the returns on an FD are fixed at the time of investment. Even if FD interest rates change over time, your FD will grow at the rate you initially booked.

faq_pairs.question: What is DICGC and which deposits are secured by them?
faq_pairs.answer: The Deposit Insurance and Credit Guarantee Corporation (DICGC) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI). It insures bank deposits, including savings, current, recurring, and fixed deposits, up to Rs. 5 lakh per account holder per bank. This insurance does not cover FDs with NBFCs.

faq_pairs.question: Can only banks offer fixed deposits?
faq_pairs.answer: No, fixed deposits are offered by banks, NBFCs, and the India Post Office. FDs with NBFCs, known as Corporate FDs, often offer higher interest rates compared to banks.

faq_pairs.question: What is an NBFC and do they also offer fixed deposits?
faq_pairs.answer: A Non-Banking Financial Corporation (NBFC) operates as a financial institution without a full banking license, regulated by the Ministry of Corporate Affairs and the Reserve Bank of India. NBFCs offer services like savings, investment plans, lending schemes, insurance, and fixed deposits.

faq_pairs.question: What is the minimum and maximum amount I can invest in a fixed deposit?
faq_pairs.answer: You can start investing in fixed deposits with a minimum amount as low as INR 5000. The maximum amount varies based on the specific FD scheme you choose.

faq_pairs.question: Is it mandatory to add a nominee?
faq_pairs.answer: No, it is not mandatory to add a nominee, but it is recommended.

faq_pairs.question: Can I add a nominee who is less than 18 years old?
faq_pairs.answer: Yes, but you must provide the details of a guardian.

faq_pairs.question: Who can I add as a nominee?
faq_pairs.answer: You can add any individual as a nominee, including family members, relatives, friends, or any trusted person.

faq_pairs.question: Can I add or change a nominee later?
faq_pairs.answer: Yes, you can add or change a nominee later, but this service is currently available only with some partner banks. You will see the “Add Nominee” option on the dashboard once your FD is successfully booked.

faq_pairs.question: What is FD advice?
faq_pairs.answer: FD advice is a computer-generated statement provided by the bank as proof of ownership or investment when you open a fixed deposit.

faq_pairs.question: I do not file taxes. Is there a way for TDS to not get deducted from the FD?
faq_pairs.answer: Currently, we do not offer a solution to avoid TDS deduction. Some banks allow the filing of forms 15G/15H, but we do not have this functionality. TDS is deducted only if the total interest from all sources with the bank exceeds Rs 40,000 for normal citizens and Rs 50,000 for senior citizens.

faq_pairs.question: How are FDs taxed?
faq_pairs.answer: Interest earnings from your fixed deposit are taxed according to your tax slab. For example, if you are in the 20% tax bracket and you earned Rs 6,000 interest from a 1-year FD of Rs 1 lakh at 6%, you will pay 20% of Rs 6,000, which is Rs 1,200, as tax.

faq_pairs.question: What is a payout account?
faq_pairs.answer: A payout account is where your fixed deposit investments will be credited upon maturity. This is the account where you will receive your money back.

faq_pairs.question: Can I add someone else's bank account details?
faq_pairs.answer: No, the payout account should belong to you. We do not allow the use of another person’s account for payout. Please use an account that is in your name.

faq_pairs.question: How can I add my bank if it is not in the list?
faq_pairs.answer: Click on the Search tab, enter your bank name, and you will be able to select your bank to add as the payout account for your fixed deposit.

faq_pairs.question: What should I do if my bank is inactive but my bank details are correct?
faq_pairs.answer: Your payout account must be an active bank account for us to credit the money on maturity or withdrawal. If your bank status is inactive, either add another active bank account or check with your bank regarding your account status.

faq_pairs.question: Why did I receive an SMS of INR 1 credit?
faq_pairs.answer: We verify your bank account by transferring INR 1. This verification process might result in an SMS from your bank informing you about the credit.

faq_pairs.question: What should I do if the bank servers are down?
faq_pairs.answer: Retry after some time or use a different bank account.

faq_pairs.question: What if my payment fails?
faq_pairs.answer: If your payment fails and the amount is deducted, it will be refunded within 2-4 working days. You can place another request for an FD if you are still interested.

faq_pairs.question: Why did my payment fail?
faq_pairs.answer: Third-party limit error: Check your daily online transaction limit in your net banking, as exceeding this limit will cause the transaction to fail. UPI limit error: UPI transactions have a daily limit of Rs 1 lakh. Ensure you are not exceeding this limit. Bank connection error: Sometimes the connection to your bank’s page or UPI app page may break during payment, causing the transaction to fail.

faq_pairs.question: What should I do if I haven't received the refund yet?
faq_pairs.answer: Your money is safe. If you haven’t received the refund within 7 working days, check your bank account statement for refund transactions and ensure 7 working days have passed.

faq_pairs.question: What should I do if I am stuck on the payment step and cannot understand the current status?
faq_pairs.answer: Click on “Go to Dashboard” to track your FDs in the Pending Investments tab.

faq_pairs.question: What interest rate will I get in case of a premature withdrawal?
faq_pairs.answer: For premature withdrawal, the interest rate applicable will be for the tenure the FD was maintained. A penalty rate will also apply, and the net off penalty rate will be the applicable interest rate.

faq_pairs.question: When and where will I receive my money in case of a withdrawal?
faq_pairs.answer: You will receive your money within 2 working days after successfully placing withdrawal instructions to the account details provided during the FD booking process.

faq_pairs.question: Are there any withdrawal processing charges?
faq_pairs.answer: No, there are no withdrawal processing charges.

faq_pairs.question: How will I know when my withdrawal is completed?
faq_pairs.answer: You will receive an SMS or notification from the bank regarding the crediting of money in your account. The FD booking will be automatically removed post-withdrawal.

faq_pairs.question: Can I prematurely withdraw my FD?
faq_pairs.answer: Yes, you can prematurely withdraw your Fixed Deposit with Axis Bank and Utkarsh Bank once the lock-in period is completed.

faq_pairs.question: What should I do if my payment was complete, but the FD status is not showing complete?
faq_pairs.answer: It can take some time for the bank to verify your application. You will receive an SMS notification once the FD is approved, which can take up to 24 hours. You can also track the status on the app dashboard.

faq_pairs.question: I haven't received the FD advice yet. Where will it get delivered?
faq_pairs.answer: The FD advice is usually delivered to your registered email ID within 7 days of successful FD booking. This document is directly shared by the bank.

faq_pairs.question: Where can I see my ongoing investments?
faq_pairs.answer: You can access your ongoing investments on the ‘My Investments’ page under the Ongoing Investments tab.

faq_pairs.question: Why is my FD rejected?
faq_pairs.answer: The FD may be rejected due to a discrepancy in the information provided. You can retry with the correct details.

faq_pairs.question: Where can I find my UPI ID?
faq_pairs.answer: Generally, you can find your UPI ID in the profile section of the respective app you are using.

faq_pairs.question: I don’t have a UPI ID. Can I apply for an IPO?
faq_pairs.answer: In case you don’t have a UPI ID, you can create it with any of the UPI Handles featured in the NPCI list.

faq_pairs.question: How can I create my UPI ID?
faq_pairs.answer:
You can follow the below steps to create a UPI ID with the BHIM app
Download the Google Pay/ PhonePe / BHIM App

faq_pairs.question: Why am I unable to apply for IPOs via my UPI ID/Handle?
faq_pairs.answer: For IPO applications, only UPI ID/Handles approved by NPCI are allowed.

faq_pairs.question: Why can’t I see my UPI handle listed in the dropdown in the Angel One app while applying for an IPO?
faq_pairs.answer: In case you can’t find your UPI Handle in the dropdown list on the IPO page in the Angel One app, it means your UPI Handle is not approved by NPCI for applying for an IPO.

faq_pairs.question: When will I receive my UPI mandate request after placing an order?
faq_pairs.answer:
Below are a few things you can do:
Go to your Payment App – Navigate to the mandate section and check if you have an open mandate or not.

faq_pairs.question: How to approve an IPO mandate request?
faq_pairs.answer: You have to approve the IPO mandate request in your UPI app.

faq_pairs.question: By when can I approve the UPI mandate request?
faq_pairs.answer: Pending mandates shall expire after 5 PM on the last day. So users should accept the mandate before 5 PM on the last day to participate in the IPO.

faq_pairs.question: What are the charges of applying for an IPO?
faq_pairs.answer: With Angel One, there are no charges to apply for an IPO.

faq_pairs.question: How can an NRI apply for an IPO using the Angel One app?
faq_pairs.answer: NRI’s can not apply via the Angel One app.

faq_pairs.question: What is the cut-off price & why should I apply at a cut-off price?
faq_pairs.answer: Cut-off price is the price at which the shares get issued through an IPO to the investors.

faq_pairs.question: Can I use a bank account not linked with Angel One to apply?
faq_pairs.answer: You can apply for an IPO using any other bank account provided the account is in the name of the investor.

faq_pairs.question: Can I apply for an IPO using my bank’s current account?
faq_pairs.answer: It is preferred that you apply using your savings account as most banks do not process IPO applications submitted using a current account.

faq_pairs.question: Can I apply for an IPO using my HUF’s account?
faq_pairs.answer: You cannot apply via the Angel One app.

faq_pairs.question: My daughter is a minor. Can I apply for an IPO using her account?
faq_pairs.answer: The Angel One app doesn’t allow a minor to apply.

faq_pairs.question: Why didn’t my account get debited after applying for an IPO?
faq_pairs.answer:
As per the ASBA process, banks will simply hold/block your money when you apply for an IPO.
Once the shares are allotted to you, the amount will be debited from your bank account.

faq_pairs.question: Can I modify my IPO bid?
faq_pairs.answer: Yes, you can modify the lot size and UPI ID of your IPO bid after placing an order.

faq_pairs.question: Why is my IPO application rejected?
faq_pairs.answer:
Few of the common reasons your IPO application is rejected
You might have entered the wrong UPI ID or UPI PIN while approving the mandate
For example: Jack is using Jill’s UPI ID to apply for an IPO with his Demat A/c. In such a case, Jack’s application will be rejected because

faq_pairs.question: When will my funds be blocked and unblocked?
faq_pairs.answer: Your funds will be blocked once you approve the UPI mandate request for IPO.

faq_pairs.question: How can I get a guaranteed IPO allotment?
faq_pairs.answer:
We would like to explain that Angel One is merely a platform to apply for IPO and has no control over its allotment. IPO allotment can never be guaranteed since, in case of over-subscription, the allotment is done via a lottery system. However, you can avoid application rejection by
Applying from only 1 Demat account per PAN
For example: Jack is using Jill’s UPI ID to apply for an IPO with his Demat A/c. In such a case, Jack’s application will be rejected because
Jill’s bank A/C used is not linked to the Demat A/c of Jack
Jill’s UPI ID used is not linked to Jack’s PAN

faq_pairs.question: Where can I check my refund status in case of a rejected/non-allotted IPO application?
faq_pairs.answer: Banks will simply hold/block your money when you apply for an IPO.

faq_pairs.question: Why didn’t I get my IPO allotment?
faq_pairs.answer:
Common reasons why you didn’t get the allotment are
Rejection – Application can be rejected due to either of the following reasons:

faq_pairs.question: Is tax applicable on profit from an IPO?
faq_pairs.answer: Tax will be levied on your profit as per your tax bracket.

faq_pairs.question: When is the next IPO coming?
faq_pairs.answer: Visit our website https://www.angelone.in/upcoming-IPO to get all information about forthcoming IPO’s.

faq_pairs.question: I have approved the mandate request, but the status on the Angel One app is still pending. What to do?
faq_pairs.answer: Your UPI mandate request status on the Angel One app does not get updated in real-time.

faq_pairs.question: Can I withdraw/delete/cancel my IPO bid?
faq_pairs.answer:
For an IPO application process in the Angel One app, withdrawing, deleting, and canceling the application is the same thing.
Follow the below path to withdraw/cancel your IPO application

faq_pairs.question: How can I check my IPO application status?
faq_pairs.answer: Follow the below path to check your IPO application status

faq_pairs.question: Where to check the IPO allotment status?
faq_pairs.answer: Follow the below path to check your subscription status

faq_pairs.question: Can I submit multiple applications for an IPO?
faq_pairs.answer: Only 1 application per PAN is recommended. Even if you apply via different platforms using the same PAN, your application will be rejected and you will not get the IPO allotment. However, you can increase the chances of IPO allotment by applying with different account linked to different PAN. For example, you can apply with your and your parents demat account separately.

faq_pairs.question: How can I place a bid for OFS?
faq_pairs.answer: As of now, we do not have an online facility for OFS order placement. You can Call us / Write to us by visiting the link at the bottom of the page.

faq_pairs.question: At what time can I bid for an Offer for Sale (OFS)?
faq_pairs.answer: You can place your bid for OFS from 9:15 AM to 3:30 PM on the OFS date.

faq_pairs.question: Can I modify or cancel my Offer for Sale bid?
faq_pairs.answer:
Yes, cancellation and modification of orders are possible before 3:20 PM.
As of now, we do not have an online facility for OFS order cancellation/modification. You can Call us / Write to us by visiting the link at the bottom of the page.

faq_pairs.question: Where can I find a list of Upcoming & past OFS?
faq_pairs.answer:
Click the link below to get the list of Upcoming & Past OFS
https://www1.nseindia.com/live_market/content/live_watch/offer_sale/ofs_sale.htm

faq_pairs.question: At what time can I bid for an Offer for Sale (OFS)?
faq_pairs.answer: You can place your bid for OFS from 9:15 AM to 3:30 PM on the OFS date.

faq_pairs.question: How many shares can I buy in an OFS?
faq_pairs.answer: There is no specific lot size required.

faq_pairs.question: When will the funds get debited for my OFS bid?
faq_pairs.answer:
Ledger amount will be blocked during the time of bidding.
If your OFS bid has been accepted and you have been allotted shares, your account will be debited for the appropriate amount at End of Trading Day.

faq_pairs.question: When would the OFS shares get credited into my Demat account?
faq_pairs.answer: If your OFS bid has been accepted and you have been allotted shares, the same will be credited to your Demat account on T + 2 days.

faq_pairs.question: What does Retail & Non-Retail category mean?
faq_pairs.answer: Retail category is for Individual Investors with a limit of Rs 2,00,000/- for Individual bids.

faq_pairs.question: If allotted, how soon can I sell off my shares?
faq_pairs.answer: Once the shares get credited into your Demat account and reflect in your Portfolio holdings, you can place your sell order any time after that.

faq_pairs.question: What is the difference between the Floor price and cut-off price?
faq_pairs.answer: Floor Price is the lowest price at which you can place your bid. This price is provided by sellers.

faq_pairs.question: Can I buy OFS using MTF (Margin Trading Facility)?
faq_pairs.answer: No, it’s not possible to bid for OFS using MTF.

faq_pairs.question: Can I place multiple bids for Offer for Sale?
faq_pairs.answer: Yes you can place multiple bids for Offer for Sale.

faq_pairs.question: What is Sovereign Gold Bond (SGB) & who is the issuer?
faq_pairs.answer: SGBs are government securities denominated in grams of gold.

faq_pairs.question: Why should I buy SGB rather than physical gold & what are the benefits?
faq_pairs.answer:
SGBs offer investors with a range of benefits, such as
The quantity of gold for which the investor pays is protected, since he receives the ongoing market price at the time of redemption/ premature redemption.

faq_pairs.question: Are there any risks in investing in SGBs?
faq_pairs.answer: There may be a risk of capital loss if the market price of gold declines.

faq_pairs.question: Who is eligible to invest in the SGBs?
faq_pairs.answer: All Indian residents as defined under Foreign Exchange Management Act, of 1999 are eligible to invest in SGBs.

faq_pairs.question: Whether joint holding will be allowed?
faq_pairs.answer: Yes, joint holding is allowed.

faq_pairs.question: Can a Minor invest in SGB?
faq_pairs.answer: Yes. The application on behalf of the minor has to be made by his/her guardian.

faq_pairs.question: What is the minimum and maximum limit for investment?
faq_pairs.answer: The Bonds are issued in denominations of one gram of gold and in multiples thereof.

faq_pairs.question: What is the rate of interest and how will the interest be paid?
faq_pairs.answer: The Bonds bear interest at the rate of 2.50% (fixed rate) per annum on the amount of initial investment.

faq_pairs.question: At what price the bonds are sold?
faq_pairs.answer: The nominal value of Gold Bonds shall be in Indian Rupees fixed on the basis of simple average of closing price of gold of 999 purity, published by the India Bullion and Jewelers Association Limited, for the last 3 business days of the week preceding the subscription period.

faq_pairs.question: Will RBI publish the rate of gold applicable every day?
faq_pairs.answer: The price of gold for the relevant tranche will be published on the RBI website two days before the issue opens.

faq_pairs.question: What will I get on redemption?
faq_pairs.answer: On maturity, the Gold Bonds shall be redeemed in Indian Rupees and the redemption price shall be based on simple average of closing price of gold of 999 purity of previous 3 business days from the date of repayment, published by the India Bullion and Jewelers Association Limited.

faq_pairs.question: How will I get the redemption amount?
faq_pairs.answer: Interest and redemption proceeds will be credited to the bank account furnished by the customer at the time of buying the bond.

faq_pairs.question: What are the procedures involved during redemption?
faq_pairs.answer: The investor will be advised one month before maturity regarding the ensuing maturity of the bond.

faq_pairs.question: Can I encash the bond anytime I want? Is premature redemption allowed?
faq_pairs.answer: Though the tenor of the bond is 8 years, early encashment/redemption of the bond is allowed after the fifth year from the date of issue.

faq_pairs.question: Can I gift the bonds to a relative or friend on some occasion?
faq_pairs.answer: The bond can be gifted/transferred to a relative/friend/anybody who fulfills the eligibility criteria

faq_pairs.question: Is tax deducted at source (TDS) applicable on the bond?
faq_pairs.answer: TDS is not applicable to the bond. However, it is the responsibility of the bond holder to comply with the tax laws.

faq_pairs.question: Can I trade these bonds?
faq_pairs.answer:
The bonds are tradable from a date to be notified by RBI. (It may be noted that only bonds held in demat form with depositories can be traded on stock exchanges)
The bonds can also be sold and transferred as per provisions of Government Securities Act, 2006. Partial transfer of bonds is also possible.

faq_pairs.question: What do the terms settlement, default, and closed mean? Do they affect my credit score?
faq_pairs.answer:
1. Settlement
• Occurs when you negotiate with a creditor to pay less than the full amount owed.
• It resolves the debt but is noted on your credit report.
• Can negatively impact your credit score.
2. Default
• Happens when you fail to make required payments on time, breaching the loan agreement.
• Significantly harms your credit score.
• May lead to legal actions or collections.
3. Closed
• Refers to an account that has been fully paid off and is no longer active.
• Can affect the length of your credit history, which is a factor in credit scoring.
All three terms can impact your credit score:
• Settlements and defaults
• Closed accounts

faq_pairs.question: What is the Annual Percentage Rate (APR)?

faq_pairs.question: My latest investment is not showing up in investments?
faq_pairs.answer:
Your Investments will appear in your ‘Investments’ Tab when your orders moves to ‘Completed’ section of your Orders Tab.

Your portfolio updation date in Order timeline is our estimate of when Unit allotment confirmation from AMC will come through.
Please do not worry, This date date does not have any relation to your NAV date. Your NAV date depend on realization of funds by AMC.

faq_pairs.question: My Current value is not updated?
faq_pairs.answer:
our Current Value for mutual fund portfolio are calculated based by latest NAVs of funds held by you.
Mutual fund NAVs (Net Asset Value) are updated every day after the market closes from Monday to Friday (All working days)
This means that the Current value you see on a particular day reflects the exact current value as per previous working day.
For example, on June 3rd, you will see the Current Value for June 2nd. The Current Value for June 3rd will be updated later on June 3rd, after the market closes. Therefore, throughout June 3rd, you will view the Current value from June 2nd. On June 4th, you will see Current Value of June 3rd.
As Saturdays and Sundays are considered holidays (along with other market holidays), there are no updates to the Current values on these days as NAV does not change.
However, certain special mutual funds (such as FoF) have their NAV updated once a week. So they current value might change if you hold these funds.

faq_pairs.question: My Mutual fund NAV is not updated
faq_pairs.answer:
Mutual fund NAVs (Net Asset Value) are updated every day after the market closes from Monday to Friday (All working days)
This means that the NAV you see on a particular day reflects the value from the previous working day.
For example, on June 3rd, you will see the NAV for June 2nd. The NAV for June 3rd will be updated later on June 3rd, after the market closes. Therefore, throughout June 3rd, you will view the NAV from June 2nd. On June 4th, you will see NAV of June 3rd.
As Saturdays and Sundays are considered holidays (along with other market holidays), there are no updates to the NAV on these days. However, certain special mutual funds (such as FoF) have their NAV updated once a week.
If you have any concerns about your mutual fund’s NAV is not being updated, please contact us.

faq_pairs.question: I got less money than what I placed an withdrawal order for?
faq_pairs.answer:
Your withdraw amount is converted to corresponding units while placing order at exchange. We calculate the units to be withdrawn based on current NAVs.
Mutual fund NAVs (Net Asset Value) are updated every day after the market closes from Monday to Friday (All working days)
For example, on June 3rd, you will see the NAV for June 2nd.
Consider the following scenario for withdraw order placed on June 3rd:
If NAV on 3rd June > 2nd June, You will receive an amount greater than order amount.
If NAV on 3rd June < 2nd June, You will receive an amount lesser than order amount.
In Summary, you will receive an amount according to latest NAV.

faq_pairs.question: Why is my instalment order in progress if SIP date is yet to come?
faq_pairs.answer:
We generally create your SIP installment order 2/3 working days before your due date as we have to co-ordinate with your Auto-pay linked bank account well in advance to ensure your SIP instalments goes through smoothly on due date.
Order Date is when we create your SIP instalment order in our system and SIP due date is when money will be debited from your Autopay linked bank account.
NAV applicable is usually of your SIP due date.

faq_pairs.question: How to link my SIP to an autopay?
faq_pairs.answer:
To check if any particular SIP is linked to an Autopay. Please click on the particular you want to link.
On top, you will see a ‘Link Autopay’ button if your SIP is not linked to autopay.

faq_pairs.question: What will happen if I do not have sufficient balance in my bank account on SIP due date?
faq_pairs.answer:
Your SIP instalment will fail if you do not ensure sufficient balance in your autopay linked bank account.
Your bank can also charge you if you do not ensure sufficient balance in your bank account on SIP due date.

faq_pairs.question: Money got deducted from my bank account but payment status shows payment in progress?
faq_pairs.answer:
We have not received confirmation of successful payment from your bank account. We will update the status as soon as possible.
Please don’t worry, If we do not get confirmation or if payment fails. Entire amount will be debited to your source bank account in 4-6 working days

faq_pairs.question: When will SIP amount get debited from my bank account for my Active SIPs?
faq_pairs.answer:
Your money will get debited automatically only if your SIP is linked to an autopay.
If your SIP is linked to an autopay. SIP amount will get debited on SIP due date.

faq_pairs.question: What is Bonus Issue?
faq_pairs.answer: Bonus shares are additional shares given by the company to existing shareholders, free of cost, in proportion to the shares held by the shareholder.

faq_pairs.question: Who is eligible for bonus shares?
faq_pairs.answer: Shareholders who own shares of the company on the record date set by the company are eligible for bonus shares.

faq_pairs.question: When will the Bonus shares be credited in my demat account?
faq_pairs.answer: The bonus shares will get credited to your demat account 10-15 days after the record date.

faq_pairs.question: Why has the average price of the stock reduced after receiving bonus shares?
faq_pairs.answer: The buy price of bonus shares is zero, as they are credited at no cost. When the shares are credited to your account, the quantity of shares increases while the invested value remains unaffected. As a result, the average price of the stock reduces. Be assured that it is correctly calculated by Angel One.

faq_pairs.question: What is buyback?
faq_pairs.answer: It is a corporate action through which a company buys back its own shares from the holders, generally at a price higher than the market price.

faq_pairs.question: How can I apply for buyback of shares?
faq_pairs.answer:

• You will receive a link from the RTA for applying for the buyback issue
• Fill in the relevant details & submit

faq_pairs.question: What is Dividend?
faq_pairs.answer: Dividend is the amount paid by a company to its shareholders out of its profits. To know more about dividend payment

faq_pairs.question: I have not received Dividend for the shares that I am holding in my demat account. What should I do?
faq_pairs.answer:
If you hold your shares in your Demat account on record date then the dividend will be credited to your bank account. However, if those shares are in Pool account, then the dividend will be credited to your Angel One ledger.
The dividend is generally paid 30-45 days after the record date.

faq_pairs.question: When and where will the dividend amount be credited?
faq_pairs.answer: The dividend will be credited directly to your bank account after 30 to 45 days from the record date.

faq_pairs.question: Will I be eligible for a dividend?
faq_pairs.answer: If you have holdings in your account as of ex-date, you are eligible to receive dividends.

faq_pairs.question: Are there any charges or deductions on dividends?
faq_pairs.answer: No, there are no charges or deductions on the dividend you receive.

faq_pairs.question: Where can I check the dividends?

Click on the specific stock that you are holding.
Scroll to the bottom of screen to find the dividend earned on the stock.
On web, click on the 3 dots that appear when you choose a stock. You will see an option to see the dividend earned.
Please note that you will receive the dividend directly to your bank statement within 30-45 days from the date of dividend payment from the company.

faq_pairs.question: What are record and ex-split dates?
faq_pairs.answer:
The record date is the date on which the company checks its records to identify the eligible shareholders for a stock split. Please note that the record date and ex-date are the same.
Ex- split date is the date on which the stock starts trading at the new adjusted split price.

faq_pairs.question: What is TPIN?
faq_pairs.answer:
TPIN stands for Transaction Personal Identification Number.
CDSL has introduced TPIN, which will enable investors to authorise selling securities from their demat accounts virtually.
For Non POA clients, TPIN verification will be valid for 1 day.
Once you generate TPIN, it will be valid till you generate it again. Hence, please make a note of your TPIN for quicker verification.
An OTP will also be required apart from TPIN for selling shares from demat account.

faq_pairs.question: How do I generate TPIN?
faq_pairs.answer:
Follow the below steps to generate a new TPIN.
• Go to Portfolio section on the App.
• Click on Verify to Sell.
• You will be redirected to CDSL website.
• Now you can either enter the existing TPIN or click on the option to generate TPIN.
• If you choose to generate TPIN, you will need to enter BO ID and PAN details.
• You can find your BO ID in Account → Profile section of the App (Also called as DP ID).
• Once you enter BO ID & PAN and then OTP, your TPIN will be sent to your mobile number and email ID.
• Please make a note of your TPIN so that you can reuse it later.

faq_pairs.question: Why did my account get deactivated?
faq_pairs.answer:
Your account may become dormant/deactivated due to the following reasons:
• You have not done any financial transaction (trading, pay-in, etc) with Angel One for more than a year.
• If any of the following 6 profile details are missing: name, PAN, address, income range, mobile number, email id
• You have been debarred from trading by SEBI.
• There is an outstanding balance issue.

faq_pairs.question: How can I reactivate my dormant account?

• You will be required to do the 2 factor authentication using your pan number registered with Angel One account
• Post successful 2FA verification, your request will be submitted and your account will be activated within 1-2 working days

faq_pairs.question: What is family declaration?
faq_pairs.answer: As per regulatory requirement, every KYC account should have a separate and unique mobile number and email address . In case if account holder wishes to use common email Id/ Mobile number for more than one account of family, it can be done after submitting a written declaration giving required details and duly signed by people involved.

faq_pairs.question: What relationships are permitted as per SEBI to be considered as family for this purpose?
faq_pairs.answer: Family for this purpose has been defined by SEBI as self, spouse, dependent parents and dependent children (in case of individual account holders)

faq_pairs.question: What relationship can be given for clients having no- individual category of account such as company, trust, HUF, AOP etc.
faq_pairs.answer: In case of non-individual category of account, if common email id/mobile number is used for more than one account then relationship can be defined as “Authorised Signatory” and the supporting needs to be submitted along with declaration such as Board resolution copy, trust/partnership deed or other such officially valid document approved giving detalils of authorized persons.

faq_pairs.question: Are siblings or other relationships such as daughter-in-law, son-in-law allowed for considering family for this purpose?
faq_pairs.answer: No. Only SEBI defined relationships of self, spouse, dependent parents and dependent children are allowed to be considered as family for this purpose. Anything else apart from this is not allowed.

faq_pairs.question: What if the client is found to be using the common email id/mobile number without allowable relationship?
faq_pairs.answer: Such account will be considered as invalid KYC accounts and will be suspended in both trading and demat account till the time unique valid KYC credentials are updated.

faq_pairs.question: How can the client change their email ID and/or Mobile number to avoid non-compliance?
faq_pairs.answer: Modification request can be submitted to change the mobile number/email ID by submitting request from the profile page of client’s account login.

faq_pairs.question: Where can a client find the Family Declaration Form?
faq_pairs.answer:
Client can download the Family Declaration Form from

Mumbai- 400 093

faq_pairs.question: Who needs to sign the Family Declaration Form?
faq_pairs.answer: The client who wants to use common email Id/ Mobile number, will mention the demat and trading account details and sign at the bottom of the page. If the demat account has more than one holder, all the holders will sign at respective place. The person who is Sellf (whose email id /mobile number is used will sign at the place “Signature of the related person”.

faq_pairs.question: What is meant by “Signature Validation Issue” on Angel One?
faq_pairs.answer: It could mean that for some reason, your signature could not be validated – it could be either because the signature itself was not valid or for some other reason. But not to worry! Our sales team will reach out to you shortly to help you resolve the issue and complete the KYC process.

faq_pairs.question: What does “PAN Validation Issue” mean on Angel One?
faq_pairs.answer:
This means that there is currently an issue in the process of validating your PAN (Permanent Account Number). It could be because –
• The user’s “Aadhaar Name” and “Name of Authorized Person in the Income Tax Return (ITR)” are different.
• The OCR has failed to capture the PAN data – perhaps the PAN copy or the photograph on the PAN card of the applicant is not clear.
• It could also be because the PAN OCR is disabled.
However, such issues can be overcome. Our sales team will reach out to you shortly and help you finish your KYC.

faq_pairs.question: What is the meaning of “Selfie Validation issue” on Angel One?
faq_pairs.answer:
This means that your selfie could not be validated because –
• It did not match certain requirements
• Selfie matched with score 69
But don’t worry! Our sales team will reach out to you shortly and help you resolve the issue.

faq_pairs.question: What is meant by “Name Mismatch issue” on Angel One?
faq_pairs.answer:
This means that there is currently an issue of mismatch among the names submitted in –
• PAN card and address proof or
• PAN card and bank proof.
Our sales team will reach out to you shortly to provide you with the steps required hereafter to complete the KYC process.

faq_pairs.question: What is the meaning of “Address Proof Validation Issue”?
faq_pairs.answer:
This basically means that there is an issue in validating the address proof because –
• The PAN is non-KRA.
• The QR code on the Aadhaar (proof of address) is not clear.
• The Aadhaar OCR is disabled.
• The address proof is something other than Aadhaar or Digilocker.
• There is mismatch in the addresses submitted in the different documents
But no worries! Our sales team will reach out to you shortly to provide you with the steps required hereafter to finish your KYC process.

faq_pairs.question: What is meant by “Bank Details Validation Issue” on Angel One?
faq_pairs.answer:
This means that there is an issue in the bank details validation process because –
• IMPS is not applicable.
• Could not perform penny drop verification.
Our sales team will reach out to you shortly to help you complete the KYC process.

Please note the following points before deleting a bank account on Angel One.
• You can add up to 5 bank accounts with Angel One.
• Even if a bank account is not being used anymore, you can add a new bank account or use any other existing bank account for all transaction-related purposes.
Once you submit the request, bank details will be approved in 2-3 working days.

faq_pairs.question: What is subscription plan?
faq_pairs.answer: A subscription plan is a tailored package designed for our clients that provides exclusive trading benefits. These benefits vary depending on the plan and include zero brokerage trades, reduced interest rates on Margin Trading Facility (MTF), and combination offers. Plans are purchased with an upfront payment and are valid for a predetermined period, with specific usage limits attached.

faq_pairs.question: How can I purchase a subscription plan?
faq_pairs.answer:
To purchase a subscription plan, navigate to Subscription Tab on Homepage or Account section then navigate to the ‘Discover Plans’ tab, select a plan to view its details, and click the ‘Buy’ button in the details page. After successful payment, the plan will be activated immediately during market hours or the next day if purchased after market hours.
Please note that the subscription plans might not be available for some users.

faq_pairs.question: What payment methods are available to purchase a subscription plans?
faq_pairs.answer: We accept several payment methods for purchasing subscription plans, including UPI, Google Pay, and PhonePe, all of which must be linked to your registered bank account with AngelOne.

faq_pairs.question: When will my plan be activated after I purchase a subscription?
faq_pairs.answer: Your subscription plan will be activated on the same day if the purchase is made within market hours. If bought post market hours, it will activate on the next day. The subscription period starts from the activation date and lasts for the duration specified in the plan.

faq_pairs.question: Can I cancel my subscription plan?
faq_pairs.answer: Clients wishing to cancel a subscription plan must submit a support ticket. It may take 3-7 days to process the cancellation request. Once the request is submitted, plan benefits will no longer be available. And if eligible you might get a refund for the subscription plan basis your utilisation.

faq_pairs.question: Will I get a refund if I cancel my subscription plan?
faq_pairs.answer: If you are eligible for a refund, based on the usage of your plan benefits and the Terms and Conditions of the subscription, the refund will be processed directly into your trading balance. The refund amount will be determined by the extent of plan utilization at the time of cancellation.

faq_pairs.question: Where can I see my active subscription plans?
faq_pairs.answer:
Your active subscription plans are displayed in two places:
• Under the ‘Your Plans’ tab in the Subscription Plan section, accessible from the homepage or your account section.
• At the top of the ‘Discover Plans’ tab, where an ‘Active Plans’ section highlights all the plans currently active for you.

faq_pairs.question: What is a Basket Order?
faq_pairs.answer: Basket Order is a feature that allows you to place multiple orders at the same time in a single click.

faq_pairs.question: Which segments are allowed within the basket?
faq_pairs.answer: All the market segments, such as Equity (Cash and F&O), Index, Currency, and Commodity are allowed within the basket.

faq_pairs.question: Which order types are allowed within the basket?
faq_pairs.answer:
Order types available within the basket are:
• Limit Order and Market Order
• Delivery, Margin, Carryforward, and Intraday
• Advanced Orders – Stop Loss, Cover, and Robo Order
Note – Please note that GTT orders cannot be placed inside the basket.

faq_pairs.question: How many baskets can be created?
faq_pairs.answer: A maximum of 50 baskets can be created and saved. Also, within each basket, a maximum of 20 securities can be added.

faq_pairs.question: Is there any charge for placing a Basket Order?
faq_pairs.answer: No, there is no additional charge for placing a Basket Order. You just have to pay the existing brokerage for the orders in the basket.

faq_pairs.question: Is there any specific time to place a Basket Order?
faq_pairs.answer: Basket Orders can be placed only within the market hours i.e., between 9:15 am and 3:15 pm. However, you can create and save the basket anytime during the day.

faq_pairs.question: Can I clone my basket?
faq_pairs.answer: Yes, you can clone your existing baskets. Additionally, you can also clone any order inside the basket.

faq_pairs.question: How to check the required margin for placing the Basket Order?
faq_pairs.answer: The required margin and the available margin will be shown upfront in the Basket. To give you the margin benefit, the required margin for the entire basket will be calculated using the SPAN calculator.

faq_pairs.question: What if the available margin is less than the required margin?
faq_pairs.answer: You can add the funds with the ‘Add Funds’ feature within the Basket to match the required margin.

faq_pairs.question: What will happen to my basket after execution?
faq_pairs.answer: After placing the Basket Order, the status of individual orders will be shown inside the basket. You can take decisions at the individual order level like modifying a pending order or retrying a failed order.

faq_pairs.question: Can I see my placed Basket Order the next day?
faq_pairs.answer: If you have saved your basket, then you can see it the next day, but the orders will be reset to the initial state i.e., before placing the Basket Order. However, you won’t be able to see the status of the orders. Please know that if you don’t manually save the basket, it will not appear in the Baskets Tab.

faq_pairs.question: What is the margin benefit in the Basket?
faq_pairs.answer: When you place individual orders, you do not get a hedging benefit and have to pay the entire required margin upfront. But when you hedge your position in the basket (i.e. combine 2 or more orders), you get the benefit of hedging in terms of lower required margin.

faq_pairs.question: Can the basket save time in order execution?
faq_pairs.answer: You can save time using Basket Order as multiple orders are placed in one click. So, there is no need to place and execute individual orders.

faq_pairs.question: Why doesn't my Limit order get executed after I reach the price I want?
faq_pairs.answer: It does not guarantee that your order will be executed even if your price has been reached. Orders are queued while being bought or sold. For Example. Assume you placed a Buy limit order of 100 Rs for the ABC script. Let’s say there are 100 buyers and 50 sellers waiting to trade in ABC at 100. ABC is currently trading at 105 Rs and after a few minutes, it reaches 100 Rs. Since there are only 50 sellers for 100 Rs, only 50 buyers will be able to buy the script once this price is reached. As for the other 50 buyers, they’ll have to wait until more sellers become available.

faq_pairs.question: What is a Margin Calculator & what is its use?
faq_pairs.answer: Margin means the amount required to buy a specific stock/Index & differ from Index to Index or share to share.

faq_pairs.question: How come I need to purchase the contracts after the stock options expire?
faq_pairs.answer: If your stock options contract expire in ITM (Profit), you will have to purchase your contracts. As a result, if you are not interested in purchasing the contracts and only interested in trading them, it is recommended that you sell them before they expire.

faq_pairs.question: Why did my order get rejected?
faq_pairs.answer: Orders can get rejected due to multiple reasons including insufficient margin, incorrect use of order type, stock not available for trading, etc.

faq_pairs.question: Why did my order get rejected with a message ‘member not allowed to place an order in this script’?
faq_pairs.answer: This message means that the selected stock is restricted from trading.

faq_pairs.question: Why does it say "New position not allowed?"
faq_pairs.answer: This happens when you place orders on low volume (Illiquid) contracts which are either long range or far month contracts. Trades in these positions are not allowed.

faq_pairs.question: What to do if my order got rejected as the stock is in square-off today?
faq_pairs.answer: If the selected stock is in square-off today, you may not be able to trade in that share. You will be allowed sell/trade post the square off is completed.

faq_pairs.question: What should I do if my order got rejected due to insufficient funds?
faq_pairs.answer: Your Orders will get Rejected if you do not have Available Margin to Trade. You can either add funds or decrease quantity of the order. You can also Increase margin by pledging your shares.

faq_pairs.question: What is margin shortfall / limit issue?
faq_pairs.answer: Margin shortfall occurs when you hold onto positions in your trading account without having sufficient margin. Kindly ensure you have sufficient balance to avoid Margin shortage penalties.

faq_pairs.question: I am getting exchange not enabled error. What could be the possible reasons?
faq_pairs.answer:
This error occurs if a particular segment is not activated for user. If you have applied for activating a segment but still getting this error, it generally happens because of two conditions.
• In NFO if income proof is not submitted.
• In MCX if electronic contract note (ECN) is not submitted.
To know more about how to activate F&O or Commodity segment, visit Account → Profile → Segment subscriptions in your web or mobile platform. You will be able to see which all segments are active and submit activation request online.

faq_pairs.question: How can I check my Order Status?
faq_pairs.answer: Tap on Orders at the bottom of your screen

faq_pairs.question: How can I know if my order has been completed?
faq_pairs.answer: Tap on Orders at the bottom of your screen

faq_pairs.question: Where can I check today's positions?
faq_pairs.answer: Tap on Orders at the bottom of your screen

faq_pairs.question: Why is my Order pending?
faq_pairs.answer: Orders can be pending due to reasons like changes in market price, order price is not reached or there are low number of buyers/sellers.

faq_pairs.question: Can I place an order when markets are closed (AMO Order)?
faq_pairs.answer: You can place AMO orders for the next trading day post market closure. AMO orders can be placed normally like a regular buy/sell order which are pushed to the exchange once the market opens.

faq_pairs.question: What is a Disclosed Quantity?
faq_pairs.answer: Disclosed quantity feature allows you to declare only a part of the actual order to the market that you want to buy/sell.

faq_pairs.question: How can I convert my F&O positions?
faq_pairs.answer: Tap on Orders at the bottom of your screen

faq_pairs.question: How can I modify my order?
faq_pairs.answer: Tap on Orders at the bottom of your screen

faq_pairs.question: How can I buy / sell stocks?
faq_pairs.answer: Tap on the share for which you want to place a Buy/Sell Order

faq_pairs.question: How can I convert my Intraday position into Delivery?
faq_pairs.answer: As of now position conversion is not available in Angel Spark. Will add FAQ’s once its introduced

faq_pairs.question: How can I place a Stop Loss order for my existing position?
faq_pairs.answer: Tap on Orders at the bottom of your screen

faq_pairs.question: What is a Robo order?
faq_pairs.answer: A Robo order is a multi-leg order used in intraday trading which allows you to place 2 more orders along with the initial order. One order is placed at a price lower than order price and other placed at a price higher than order price.

faq_pairs.question: Can I place a Robo order on the NSE and BSE?
faq_pairs.answer: Yes, Robo orders can be placed in both NSE and BSE

faq_pairs.question: Which product type allows to place Robo Orders?
faq_pairs.answer: You can place Robo orders only in Intraday.

faq_pairs.question: Can I avail MTF facility for Robo order?
faq_pairs.answer: No, the MTF facility is unavailable for Robo orders.

faq_pairs.question: Can I place Robo orders in commodities and currencies?
faq_pairs.answer: Robo orders can only be placed in the cash market segment (Equity and Derivatives) for stocks and indices.

faq_pairs.question: Can I place a delivery order using Robo order?
faq_pairs.answer: No, you cannot place a Robo order in Delivery trading.

faq_pairs.question: Can I place a Robo order in all stocks?
faq_pairs.answer: Robo orders can be placed in selected scrips of cash segment for intraday trading. Robo orders can not be placed on low volume scrips.

faq_pairs.question: Can I place a Robo order at any time during the day?
faq_pairs.answer: You can place a Robo order between 9:15 AM to 3:10 PM on a trading day.

faq_pairs.question: What if my Robo order does not get executed during the day?
faq_pairs.answer: If your first-leg order (initial Limit order) doesn’t get executed during the market hours of the trading day, then the Robo order will get cancelled.

faq_pairs.question: How many times a Robo order can be modified?
faq_pairs.answer:
Robo order can be modified in the following ways any number of times:
Initial Order can be modified in cases the Order has not been executed.

faq_pairs.question: How to place a Robo order?
faq_pairs.answer: Tap on Watchlist at the bottom of your screen

faq_pairs.question: How to place robo order on desktop or web?
faq_pairs.answer: Currently, we have robo order feature only on mobile app. We are working on bringing it to web as well.

faq_pairs.question: What are the timings for Intraday Square-Off?
faq_pairs.answer:
Below are the timings for Intraday Square-Off:
Equity Segment: 3:15 pm

faq_pairs.question: Why was my position squared off?
faq_pairs.answer:
Your position could have been squared off due to any of the below reasons:
• Intraday trades will auto squared off at 3:15 pm for the Cash segment and at 3:20 for the F&O segment.
• Intraday trades will be squared off if you lose 80% of your Available Margin.
• When you don’t maintain the minimum required margin in your account your shares will be squared off 4 days after the shortfall occurs.
• When your shares bought using Margin are down by more than 50% of your fund balance, square-off will be done on the next trading day.
• Shares bought under Margin Product need to be fully paid or pledged, failing which the shared will be squared off after 7 days.
• If your account goes under debit/negative balance, then your shares will be squared off after 7 days.

faq_pairs.question: Why was my Intraday Position not squared off?
faq_pairs.answer: Your buy/sell position might not be squared off due to upper/lower circuit in that stock.

faq_pairs.question: When I am trying to exit my position or place a Stop-Loss order, why is it being rejected?
faq_pairs.answer: It may happen if you have a pending Stop-Loss (SL) or an exit order already. With an already pending stop-loss or exit order, you will need extra funds to be able to place a duplicate SL/exit order. If you do not have this extra fund in your account, then your duplicate exit order will get rejected. That’s why we inform you while exiting if there’s a Pending SL/exit order against a position, to avoid any duplicate orders and rejections.

faq_pairs.question: My Stop-Loss (SL) order was triggered but it did not get executed. Why did this happen?
faq_pairs.answer:
There could be 2 major reasons behind this:
• The asset may be lacking a buyer/seller at the defined stop-loss limit price due to a lack of market depth. Orders are queued while they are being purchased or sold.
• The price movement during high volatility does not fulfill certain criteria e.g. suppose you have placed a
Note:

faq_pairs.question: My stop-loss order got triggered even though the predefined Trigger Price had not appeared. Why?
faq_pairs.answer: Chances are that the market price did hit the stop-loss price, albeit momentarily and without you being able to spot it at that moment. Within a second, prices can change multiple times and not all of them are relayed to the Brokers by Exchange, especially during high volatility. As a result, such momentary price fluctuations are not seen anywhere.

faq_pairs.question: What is Stop Loss?
faq_pairs.answer: Stop-loss is a tool that investors use to minimise the loss in a trade. Some traders define it as an advance order, which triggers an automatic closure of an open position when the stock price reaches the trigger price level.

faq_pairs.question: What is Trailing Stop Loss?
faq_pairs.answer: A Trailing Stop-loss is an order that lets you set a maximum value or percentage of loss you can incur on a trade. If the securiy price rises or falls in your favour, the trigger price jumps with it at the set value or percentage. If the security price rises or falls against you, the trigger price stays in place depending on the nature of the order.

faq_pairs.question: How does a Stop-loss get triggered?
faq_pairs.answer: Stop-loss can be your real saviour during a volatile market condition. A price level set at the beginning of the trade allows traders to close their position automatically when the stop-loss is reached. Squaring off takes place at the next price available at the trigger price level and helps limit losses.

faq_pairs.question: What is the 1% rule of trading?
faq_pairs.answer: The 1% rule defines the maximum limit of risk one can take in a trade or the risk-per-trade. It implies adjusting your position so that total loss doesn’t cross 1% of your trade value when the stop-loss is triggered. The 1% rule helps avoid significant losses.

faq_pairs.question: Can I use stop-loss in trading with the AngelOne Trading app?
faq_pairs.answer:
You can place a Stop loss order in AngelOne mobile app by following the below simple steps:
• Visit the AngelOne app and select the stock to Buy/Sell
• Select quantity of the trade
• Set’ Trigger price’
• Enter the price where you want to place stop-loss
• Confirm the stop-loss price, click on “Buy/Sell” and confirm the order

faq_pairs.question: What is the difference between Limit and Market orders?
faq_pairs.answer:
In a Limit Order the buying price or sell price is specified and the trade is executed only when the price is met.
In contrast, a Market Order gets executed at the current market price.

faq_pairs.question: What is an Immediate or Cancel (IOC) order?
faq_pairs.answer: In the case of Immediate or Cancel (IOC) order, the order has to be executed as soon as it is released in the market. It means that the buying or selling of the security happens almost immediately, and if it doesn’t, the order gets cancelled automatically.

faq_pairs.question: How do i place an GTT Order?
faq_pairs.answer: Tap on the share for which you want to place a GTT Order

faq_pairs.question: What are Stop Loss Orders?
faq_pairs.answer: A stop-loss order is a buy/sell order that can help you limit your losses in case the prices move against your trade.

faq_pairs.question: What is Good Till Trigger Order(GTT)?
faq_pairs.answer: GTT order allows you to place buy or sell orders at a predetermined price.

faq_pairs.question: What is the validity for GTT Order?
faq_pairs.answer: GTT Order is a feature that allows you to Buy/Sell shares at your desired price with 1 year order expiry date.

faq_pairs.question: Can I place an Intraday Order using GTT?
faq_pairs.answer: GTT feature cannot be used for Intraday.

faq_pairs.question: Which segments can GTT Order be used for?
faq_pairs.answer: GTT order can be used for Equity Cash segment under Delivery Margin Product Type

faq_pairs.question: Why did my Limit Order get executed at market price?
faq_pairs.answer: This might have happened if you have tried to sell at a price lower than the current market price OR buy at a price higher than current price. In such a situation, the system considers it as a market order and executes it at the current price.

faq_pairs.question: Why was my stop loss order executed even though the price did not breach my trigger?
faq_pairs.answer: Within a second multiple prices are received. Not all the price changes are shown on the application. It is possible that the price was breached but could not be shown on the application. This may have happened since you are able to see just one tick per second, you may not be able to see the price when the stop-loss limit is breached and the trade is executed.

faq_pairs.question: Why did my market order in the pre-open session become a limit order?
faq_pairs.answer:
In the pre-open session, all unmatched market orders are carried over to the normal market with their original timestamp as limit orders at the equilibrium price.
If the opening-price is not discovered, market orders will be carried over at the previous day’s closing price

faq_pairs.question: What is an Immediate or Cancel Order (IOC) order?
faq_pairs.answer: In the case of an immediate or cancel order, the order has to be executed as soon as it is released in the market.

faq_pairs.question: What is a Delivery Order?
faq_pairs.answer: Delivery Order means you buy some shares, and hold them in your demat account. You can hold them in your demat account as long as you want. Delivery orders are used for long term investments.

faq_pairs.question: What is an Intraday Order?
faq_pairs.answer: Intraday Order means buying/selling a security with the intention of exiting the position on the same day. You can exit the position whenever you want within the day. All the intraday orders are automatically squared off if left open.

faq_pairs.question: What is an AMO Order?
faq_pairs.answer: AMO orders are Orders that are placed post market closure.

faq_pairs.question: What is a Limit Order?
faq_pairs.answer: A limit order is an order to buy or sell a stock at a specific price. these orders are valid for a day. if price is not reached within the day, these orders are automatially cancelled.

faq_pairs.question: What is a Market Order?
faq_pairs.answer: A market order is a buy or sell order to be executed immediately at the next price match. these orders are used when you want to buy/sell desired quantity as soon as possible.

faq_pairs.question: What is Call and Trade facility? Are there any charges for this facility?
faq_pairs.answer: Call and Trade facility allows you to place a trade by calling Angel One.

faq_pairs.question: How many watchlists can be added?
faq_pairs.answer: You can add up to 5 watchlists.

faq_pairs.question: How many stocks can be added in each watchlist?
faq_pairs.answer: You can add up to 50 stocks per watchlist.

faq_pairs.question: How can I create a watchlist?
faq_pairs.answer:
You can create a watchlist by following these steps.
Go to watchlist screen.
On web as well as mobile app, you will find a + icon to create a new watchlist.
Name the watchlist and click on create.
You can search the stocks and add them to the created watchlists.
